result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destiny R. Edwards

Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant to the court
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of substantial battery and 2 cts. misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with A.R.H., DOB: 05-14-2000 or any premises they may occupy..  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
